intro: Eurya japonica f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Japanese eurya, is a compact evergreen shrub native to Japan. It features small, elliptical, dark green leaves that are typically narrow and glossy. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers in clusters during the spring, which are followed by bright red,浆果-like berries in the fall. It thrives in partial to full shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and seasonal interest throughout the year.
